original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up in mid-day trade, rupee at 321.50/75 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were up in the mid-day trade on Friday while the rupee quoted at 321.50/75 against the US dollar, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 26.70/90 percent, up from 26.30/80 percent.
“Other bills and bonds were not active for the day” a dealer said.
The rupee was quoted at 321.50/75 to the US dollar in the spot market. (Colombo/April21/2023)
